summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Ad Hoc Committee on Pensions of the Dallas City Council will convene on February 8, 2024, at 3:15 PM. The meeting will take place both in-person at the City Council Chambers and virtually. The primary purpose is to discuss pension-related matters, including actuarial analyses and investment policies.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of the minutes from the January 11, 2024, meeting.
2. Briefing on the Dallas Police and Fire Pension System, focusing on an independent actuarial analysis and preliminary recommendations based on the 2023 actuarial valuation.
3. Overview of the investment policy, oversight, and performance of the Dallas Police and Fire Pension System.

**Important Details**:  
The meeting will feature presentations from the Pension Review Boardâ€™s independent actuary, Cheiron, outlining key findings and recommendations regarding the pension system's financial health. The committee will also review the investment policy to ensure it aligns with best practices and performance expectations.

**Action Items**:  
The committee seeks approval of the meeting minutes and will deliberate on the actuarial recommendations and investment policy. The outcomes of these discussions may influence future decisions regarding pension funding and management strategies. An executive session may be held if legal or sensitive matters arise during discussions.
